title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Interview Descriptions: It was fine. We talked about past jobs and cares. We discussed what the job would entail. I enjoy that we can med pass. It seems like a nice facility. I am excited.
Interview Questions: Mostly about past jobs and cares

title: RN NURSE Interview
Interview Descriptions: Not bad, didn't take long to get hired. The questions were relevant to the job I was applying for. They were very flexible in making appointment.  Looking for caring people.
Interview Questions: Tell us one situation where you solved a problem.

title: Supply Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Augustana Care (Apple Valley, MN) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a phone interview.  It was an ok interview but the lady was very disorganized and was rude. She just kept repeating the questions. The description of this job is not what the job entails.  This job is for stocking all of the nurses' closets in all buildings and going into residences rooms to stock health products in the rooms. The first impression of this place for me is that they wanted someone in school and someone with lots of experience but was described as an entry-level position.
Interview Questions:
Can you start on Monday?
Have you worked in a hospital setting?
Do you have a stocking experience?
Are you in any educational program now? (This question seemed very important to them)

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Augustana Care (Hopkins, MN) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was great. A phone interview was first and followed by an in person interview. A tour of the place was given as well. Staff were all very nice and friendly.
Interview Questions: What interest you into the nursing profession?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Augustana Care (Hastings, MN) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was to get certified as a nursing assistant and I would be hired.   I took classes for 2 months and took the state test and passed to become certified.  I had 2 weeks of training on the job and 90 probationary period.  My position was contingent upon me passing this test.  I found the management to be friendly and helpful.
Interview Questions: If I felt I could obtain a CNA.
